doc.line: FuelStopAdvisor = This interface offers functionalities to access the fuel stop advisor features
This interface is defined for the FSA demonstrator and not included into the GENIVI compliance
GetVersion = This method returns the API version implemented by the server application
version = struct(major,minor,micro,date)
major = when the major changes, then backward compatibility with previous releases is not granted
minor = when the minor changes, then backward compatibility with previous releases is granted, but something changed in the implementation of the API (e.g. new methods may have been added)
micro = when the micro changes, then backward compatibility with previous releases is granted (bug fixes or documentation modifications)
date = release date (e.g. 21-06-2011)
SetUnits = This method sets the calculation unit for a given value
data = dictionary[key,value]
dictionary = array of tuples (key,value)
Invalid data is not be returned to the client application
key = enum(INVALID,ODOMETER,FUEL_LEVEL,DISTANCE,INSTANT_FUEL_CONSUMPTION_PER_DISTANCE,AVERAGE_FUEL_CONSUMPTION_PER_DISTANCE,AVERAGE_SPEED,TANK_DISTANCE,ENHANCED_TANK_DISTANCE,...,ALL)
for each key, the value of type 'q' expresses the unit used, METRIC or NON_METRIC
see details for each key into the getters
GetInstantData = This method returns a given set of global (not related to a trip number) trip computer data (e.g. odometer, fuel level, tank distance... )
data = dictionary[key,value]
dictionary = array of tuples (key,value)
Invalid data is not be returned to the client application
key = enum(INVALID,ODOMETER,FUEL_LEVEL,TANK_DISTANCE,ENHANCED_TANK_DISTANCE,...,ALL)
key = ODOMETER, value = value of type 'u', that expresses the total distance counter in: METRIC->tenth of kilometers NON_METRIC->tenth of miles
key = FUEL_LEVEL, value = value of type 'q', that expresses fuel level in: METRIC->tenth of liters NON_METRIC->hundreth of gallon
key = TANK_DISTANCE, value = value of type 'q', that expresses the tank distance since the last reset of the trip computer in METRIC->kilometers or in NON_METRIC->miles
key = ENHANCED_TANK_DISTANCE, value = value of type 'q', that expresses the tank distance since the last reset of the trip computer in METRIC->kilometers or in NON_METRIC->miles
GetSupportedTripNumbers = This method returns the number of supported trips
tripNumbers = value of 'y'
GetTripData = This method returns the data of a given trip number
number= value of type 'y' that expresses the trip number (start number is 0)
data = dictionary[key,value]
dictionary = array of tuples (key,value)
Invalid data is not be returned to the client application
key = enum(INVALID,DISTANCE,TIME,INSTANT_FUEL_CONSUMPTION_PER_DISTANCE,AVERAGE_FUEL_CONSUMPTION_PER_DISTANCE,AVERAGE_SPEED,...,ALL)
key = DISTANCE, value = value of type 'q', that expresses the distance since the last reset of the trip computer in METRIC->tenth of kilometers or in NON_METRIC->tenth of miles
key = TIME, value = value of type 'u', that expresses the elapsed time since the last reset of the trip computer in seconds

key = INSTANT_FUEL_CONSUMPTION_PER_DISTANCE, value = value of type 'q', that expresses the instant fuel consumption per distance in METRIC->tenth of liters per 100 kilometers or the instant distance per fuel consumption in NON_METRIC->tenth of miles per gallon

key = AVERAGE_FUEL_CONSUMPTION_PER_DISTANCE, value = value of type 'q', that expresses the average fuel consumption per distance since the last reset of the trip computer in METRIC->tenth of liters per 100 kilometers or the average distance per fuel consumption in NON_METRIC->tenth of miles per gallon

key = AVERAGE_SPEED, value = value of type 'q', that expresses the average speed since the last reset of the trip computer in METRIC->tenth of kilometers per hour or in NON_METRIC->tenth of miles per hour
ResetTripData = This method resets the data of a given trip
number= value of type 'y' that expresses the trip number
TripDataReset = This signal is emitted to notifiy a client application that the data of the given trip number has been resetted
number= value of type 'y' that expresses the trip number
TripDataUpdated = This signal is emitted to notifiy a client application that the data has been updated
number= value of type 'y' that expresses the trip number
SetFuelAdvisorSettings = This method configures the fuel stop advisor settings
advisorMode = flag. TRUE means that the advisor is activated
distanceThreshold= value of type 'y' that expresses the distance threshold in METRIC->kilometers or in NON_METRIC->miles
GetFuelAdvisorSettings = This method get the fuel stop advisor settings
advisorMode = flag. TRUE means that the advisor is activated
distanceThreshold= value of type 'y' that expresses the distance threshold in METRIC->kilometers or in NON_METRIC->miles
SetRouteHandle = This method configures the route handle for the enhanced tank distance
routeHandle = Route handle. Range[0x0:0x7fffffff].
ReleaseRouteHandle = This method release the route handle for the enhanced tank distance
routeHandle = Route handle. Range[0x0:0x7fffffff].
FuelStopAdvisorWarning = This signal is emitted to notify a client application that there's a risk of not reaching the destination
